attributes.action: Place  a legal obligation on politicians to deliver campaign promises.
attributes.additional_details:
Inspired by Nigel Farage's reversal on the £350 million a week promise for the NHS, the day after the Brexit vote. 

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36624697
attributes.background:
The Farage 350 Law.
Campaign promises are often quickly discarded. The public has little faith in promises made. We have a right to hold politicians to their word.  Campaign promises must be registered, costed, deliverable. Barring exceptional external change, they must be delivered.
